Property.preferredDefinition: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the eye that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs.:Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the eye. Representative examples include conjunctivitis, glaucoma, cataract, conjunctival squamous cell carcinoma, uveal melanoma, and retinoblastoma.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Questions assess personal and family history among adults of glaucoma, macular degeneration, cataract, and diabetic retinopathy, including history of any associated laser or eye surgeries
